member.name: T:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask
member.summary: A task that consolidates all the information required for the learning API call: the symbol, spec, and additional request parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.Language
member.summary: The language from which a caller wants to synthesize programs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.Symbol
member.summary: The root symbol for the language from which a caller wants to synthesize programs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.Spec
member.summary: The spec that the synthesized programs have to satisfy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.AdditionalInputs
member.summary: Optional additional representative inputs, provided during the learning process

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.IsOneShot
member.summary: True if the learning is one-shot, i.e., requested on a ; false if the learning is incremental, i.e., requested on a .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.RecursionDepths
member.summary: The number of times grammar symbols appeared in the synthesis call stack up to and including this call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.K
member.summary: An optional restriction on the number of synthesized programs. A caller may request only top-K programs according to the specified feature value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.Feature
member.summary: An optional ranking feature for selecting top-k synthesized programs. A caller may request only top-K programs according to the specified feature value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.ProvidedInputs
member.summary: Returns a union of all input states provided in the task: the ones embedded in the spec and the ones provided additionally.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.LearningTask.MakeSubtask(Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Rules.NonterminalRule,System.Int32,Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Specifications.Spec)
member.summary: Creates a parameter learning subtask from a given learning task, and updates the tracked recursion info.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: uses strategies () to perform tasks to learn a program.

member.summary: Filters a given down only to a programs that are consistent with a given .
member.param: A synthesis engine that will be used to resolve learning calls generated during filtering. Must be initialized with a strategy and a suitable for the language of .
A cancellation token. Will be passed to the learning methods of .
member.returns: A representing a subset of the programs contained in the current instance that satisfy .
member.remarks: When possible, this implementation should be preferred to . Use the latter one only when this implementation fails to produce a satisfactory result.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.Strategies.DomainGuidedCBS
member.summary: The domain-guided component-based synthesis strategy. This is a bottom-up synthesis stategy which uses operator-specific lifting functions provided for any DSL operators and standard component-based synthesis when these are not provided.

member.summary: The deductive synthesis strategy, which leverages instances for iterative refinement of the specification.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Learning.Strategies.DeductiveSynthesis.FindMostApplicablePlans(Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Rules.GrammarRule,Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis.Specifications.Spec)
member.summary: Find the most applicable plans for the and the given . Prefer plans that are user-defined and accept more specific spec.

summary.para: Calculates the threshold for a program set with a future dependency during ordered program synthesis.

Consider a synthesis task LearnSymbolTopK(N, spec, k) where N := F(A, B) and a witness function for B depends on the value of A. In this case we only need to learn top-K programs for B, but (in general) we have to learn all programs for A, because we don't know the cluster of As that contains the parameter that will yield the highest-ranked F(A, B). PrereqProgramsThreshold is a function that takes as input the value of k and outputs the corresponding value of k' â€” the number of top programs to be learnt for the independent parameter A. If it outputs null, Microsoft.ProgramSynthesis learns all programs for A.
summary.remarks: If the ranking function for the DSL is monotonic (higher scores for subexpressions yield higher scores for expressions that contain them), then k' = 1 is guaranteed to produce the highest-ranked result.
